reviewText: I'm now watching the 5th season of this show and am somewhat bewildered by why only one season of this show is on DVD.  I am NOT someone who took to this reality tv show genre with two big exceptions.  I do watch this show and PROJECT RUNWAY.  I have not even been tempted to watch any of the other reality tv shows.I first saw Kathy on SEINFELD.  Jerry is remarking to Kramer how terrible a stand up comic Kathy is and Kramer turns around and tells Kathy this dig.  In retaliation, Kathy stages a new show which completely tears apart Jerry Seinfeld, the stand-up comic, and it is a big hit, especially with everyone Jerry knows.Nowadays Kathy Griffin does stand up comedy shows plus also her own reality tv show.  The basis for the title is that Kathy is so far down the food chain as a celebrity that she is on the D List and hasn't got a chance of hitting the Hollywood A list (where Jerry Seinfeld is).The show is Kathy trying to forge her way up the food chain and beyond being on the D list.  She has some hilarious moments doing gigs that most other comics would rather die first before doing.  However, Kathy is unstoppable.  She is also incapable of being insulted.  Like most stand-up comics, she is very fast on her feet and can come back with rejoinders right away.  She also involves everyone she can in her quest and her parents have become mini stars in their own right. (her Dad has since died but her Mom remains a big hit)Since this first season she has won two Emmys for the show.  We are now on the 5th Season and Kathy Griffin, I submit, is no longer on the D list.  I don't know if she is on the A list yet, I doubt it, but she is moving up fast on the inside track.  I've also noticed that some of the bigger names are now getting her on their shows.  For example, during the time Letterman was getting pilloried over his Sarah Palin jokes, he brought Griffin on and she managed to get off a few key lines which helped Letterman's cause.  I also saw her appear on Howard Stern TV and there was nothing that he and his band of goons could say to fluster her.  She is so on top of her comedic game that they didn't have a chance up against her.  They were not able to land one blow on her, try as they did.  This was the first time I ever watched that show because normally I totally hate everyone on it.  Kathy is also the emcee for the Joan Rivers roast which is being broadcast this month.It really is great to see a female stand up comic start to make it like a Jerry Seinfeld.  Griffin is out there in the vanguard and doing one heck of a job.
summary: Kathy Griffin Is A Wonderful Comedian & Stand Up Comic
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'd seen Kathy Griffin live at a local theatre, and also enjoyed her on "Suddenly Susan" and particularly when she co-hosted a New Year's Eve show this past December 31 with Anderson Cooper, not to mention her many appearances on TV over the years.  She always makes me laugh, and that's the main reason I wanted to catch up on "D-List," as I don't have cable and the DVD was on sale for a remarkably low price.  I'm not sure it's best to watch too many episodes in a row, as I did when I first got the DVD (four episodes in a row, for example, on my first viewing), as Kathy is one intense woman--at least as portrayed here.  That's not a bad thing overall, as her intensity is part of the reason she can be so overwhelmingly funny, but I would suggest taking a break between episodes.  It's fascinating to watch her hang with her parents, "her gays," as she calls two of her best male friends, her assistant, and her husband as she navigates the clearly treacherous waters of life in Hollywood.  Never has it been both so glamourous and so depressing--it should be viewed by anyone wanting to break into that lifestyle, for cautionary purposes!  But, in the end, the viewer gets the feeling you could survive--and laugh--through most of it if one of your friends in Hollywood happened to be Kathy.  I recommend this DVD if you're a fan of Kathy's or if you're fascinated by behind-the-scenes Hollywood...or if you just like to laugh!
Title: N/A

reviewText: The always hilarious Kathy Griffin shines in the self-titled reality series following her life and work as a stand-up comedian and actress. Griffin has long maintained the fact that she is a "D-list" celebrity and she claims this status was solidified with her appearance on Celebrity Mole: Hawaii, which she won. The series gives viewers a real insight into her life as it is entirely unscripted and features Kathy's husband as well as her parents and friends. When Kathy is shown going from venue to venue to perform, viewers are almost given an all access pass backstage as they get to see her planning her act as well as trying out material with her family and friends. The series is effective in conveying how Griffin is seen on the social scale in Hollywood and also shows that behind all her bravado, she can be quite fragile and sensitive. Fans of Kathy Griffin will adore this as well as fans of reality television. This is one of the best reality shows I have ever seen and will entertain anyone who loves comedy!
Title: N/A

reviewText: No doubt about it: Kathy Griffin is hilarious.  If you enjoy someone poking fun of herself and others, then you will LOVE Kathy's brand of humor.  She's bitingly sarcastic (in a good way), but also shows a tender side at times when it comes to her husband and parents.  I'm a reality show fan by no means, but that's the great thing about Kathy's D-List show.  It doesn't feel like a reality show; it's more of a comedy that keeps me entertained for one hour a week on the Bravo network (or 267 minutes if I sit down and watch the DVDs of Season One back-to-back).  And since "Kathy Griffin: My Life on the D-List" seasons are impossible to find in stores, you HAVE to buy it from Amazon.  Get your copy today!! (A little plug for ya, Kathy.)  Oh, and don't forget, her stand-up DVDKathy Griffin - Allegedly.

reviewText: Season One of "Kathy Griffin: My Life on the D-List" is finally available, and the nice folks at Bravo have even gone the extra mile to tack on "Kathy Griffin is...Not Nicole Kidman" which is a stand-up special from 2005. I don't know what I've enjoyed more! Kathy is so quick and so impulsive, even the members of "Team Griffin" it seems are often surprised at how funny she is when she's not even trying. Even her stand-up special is so original and unscripted, it's like watching one big improvisational conversation, between Kathy and her audience. My only gripe is that the Bravo people found it necessary even here on its DVD release, to 'bleep' the explatives like they do for the TV broadcasts. While it might be a bit more family friendly, Kathy's cusses make it all the more chuckle worthy. (***Check out Kathy's DVD "Allegedly" for more uncensored laughs than you can handle. ***) All in all, it's a great DVD. Looking forward to Season 2 of My Life on the D-List. Thanks for all the laughs Kathy!
summary: Kathy is A-List all the way!

reviewText: I've been watching this show since its premiere on Bravo channel.They usually play episodes back-to-back.  Once I'm tuned in, I ride it to the end.  And actually feel sad, when Bravo ends my hours of watching Kathy.Kathy's supporting cast for season one include her assistant Jessica, her ex-hubby, and her parents.  I'm surprised her parents didn't get Emmy nominated for supporting cast.  (I have no faith in the Emmy's, because of it.)Kathy is precocious.  She isn't shy about letting her audience see everything behind the scenes, as-is.In one episode, she hosts a Toys for Tots party.  She asks Marines to show her guests where the bathroom is in her house.  The looks on their faces! lol.  And she bosses Ray Romano into showing up at her party.

When you purchase this type of DVD, who cares about the language?  Other than that one issue, a must-see for her fans!

reviewText: To the reviewer who said you don't have to be gay to love this I say, A-MEN! Not AMEN like "A MEN" as in "MAN" because that might be interpreted as inappropriate for a straight person and could possibly get me excommunicated from the church.I will say this, I have been repeatedly accused by scads of people (mostly gentle people) as being "too openminded" and "the last noble man on Earth." I can't really say if they're right, because I think it would come off as arrogant. But, I also think it would be disingenuine to dismiss their claims entirely. Let's just table this discussion and focus our talk on KG.I love Kathie Griffin. She's self-aware and her rapier-like wit is like some sort of knife in the way it cuts its victims to the soul ... which is no big deal, cause they usually don't have one -- a soul that is. Which reminds me, people also say I'm "soulful and sensitive." Which is a tag that sounds a little too Josh Groban for me. No offence of course, Josh is a doll, but just a bit soft for me. So if we do happen to meet, please refrain from making that comparison.Kathy tickles me to the bone (which is suprisingly painful), and I have to say she dazzles with her wit.  Kathy's also great at maximizing awkwardness -- which reminds me a lot of my dad -- when he'd call me names in front of my friends. There's a lot of scarring there. Kathie helps me deal with it. Thank you Kathy, you delicious, hysterical, beautiful woman!

reviewText: If you like Kathy Griffin, then you will love this dvd set. There are 6 episodes of her reality show, which is very interesting, she does live an interesting and eventful life, especially when she's on the road, she definitely makes it interesting, and what's even better, there are clips here and there of her appearances and stand-up acts. So when you watch the special included on the second disc, "Kathy Griffin is... Not Nicole Kidman" well.....I never laughed so much, it was LOL non-stop and I got a sore throat afterwards, because it was so funny. Of course it's full of f*** words and the lot but she is even funnier than Ellen. I know she makes fun of celebrities, but we can afford the luxury of watching from our homes and not feel insulted by it. So if you can do that, you will have a roll.After watching the special I am ordering the Allegedly dvd rightaway, I hope there will be more shows of her put on dvd and hope for the subsequent releases of her reality show, seeing as those even won Emmys.
summary: Unbelievably hilarious special inside, and the series is very interesting and funny

reviewText: The one thing that's always bugged me about reality TV, is the fact that most of it looks staged ("Gee, I think, for no readily available reason, I'm gonna take off my cloths and jump into this public swimming pool...") but that is the one thing that grabs you from the get go in this show, is that Kathy Griffin seems so frazzled most of the time (what with her self proclaimed D-list status, making her do twice the amount of work, for half the recognition) and doesn't really seem to notice the camera invasion, about 95% of the time (the other 5% has her playing to the camera like any comedian worth their salt would, being as cuttingly insightful as she can be, and ripping on anyone she can get her mind around, including, herself).It's GREAT to finally get the whole first season (with the second to follow, fingers crossed) on DVD, as here in Canada, it was next to impossible to find it's air time on the station that was broadcasting it, and as a result, I only managed to see an episode and a haf of the show, but what I did see was a funny, oddly cute, but also vulnerable, side of Kathy Griffin ("don't call me GIFFORD!!!") that wasn't so much invasive (as most reality TV tries to be) but more documentaries, in a wholly entertaining and unabashed look into this funny lady's hectic life.Just a note, yes the censor bleeps are still there, but in all reality, I think it adds to the hilarity of the show (kind of like Yo' Semity Sam, from the Buggs Bunny Show, when he'd curse under his breath, you couldn't quite make out what he was saying, and that only made it all the more funnier).Or is it just me?
summary: FROM ONE REALITY SHOW HATER TO ANOTHER, THIS SHOW ROCKS...!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Aside from being one of the great stand ups of our time, Kathy puts her money where her mouth is and invites a camera crew to spend some time filming her, her husband, her parents, her put upon assistant Jessica(?) and her dogs while she makes personal appearances and generally tries to score free stuff. Beloved by gays for demystifying the celebrity "gift bag" and the hefty portions of celebrity dish she serves up, Griffin shows that she does not need to be onstage to be funny.  Her observations are razor sharp, but she also pokes fun at herself and her celebrity status as a  D list celebrity.  There are still some remains of a little greasy triangle on my TV screen from my nose pressed up against the picture tube (At least that is what I tell everyone it is)during what has to be the funniest 6 hours of television- rivaled only by the second season.  Here is hoping for lots of extras.  Kathy has something for everyone to laugh at...er with.  I'm hoping for a big gift set with the 2 (so far) seasons and all her Bravo concerts.  Griffin not only dishes the dirt- she makes it taste like a five star meal!  Buy it Buy it buy it!
summary: You don't have to be gay to love this
